title: Ticket #2903: condor_status exit with eror 1 with argument -attribute
description:
As a reaction to mail from condor-users mailing list, I tried next commands: 

sh-3.2$ condor_status -attributes MyAddress -f "%s \n" 'regexps("<([^:]+):\d+>", MyAddress, "\1")'
condor_status: unknown host %s \n
sh-3.2$ echo $?
1
sh-3.2$ condor_status -f "%s \n" 'regexps("<([^:]+):\d+>", MyAddress, "\1")' -attributes MyAddress
192.168.0.1

It look like parsing of command line arguments is broken.
remarks:
2012-Apr-06 11:03:06 by tstclair:
reviewed and applied, no comments.
attachments:
• 0001-Fixed-parsing-condor_status-command-line-arguments.patch 2296 bytes added by slebodnik on 2012-Mar-22 21:51:35 UTC.
    Some condor_status command line arguments (-attributes and -target) require only one argument. This is correctly described in manual pages, but two arguments are skipped during the processing of command line arguments (function secondPass())
check_ins: 2012-Apr-06 10:58   Check-in [31532]: #2903 Fixed parsing condor_status command line arguments. -attributes and -target requires only 1 argument, but 2 arguments was skipped. Committer: Timothy St. Clair (By Lukas Slebodnik )
creator: slebodnik
